pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

|-:|:-:|:-|

Current commit [fb054a223e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/fb054a223e7d0382f025bc094ee55e7d106c2643)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

:v: mo271 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
@mo271 can you please take into account the comments (and fix the conflict)? Thanks!
@mo271 the build is still failing

> @mo271 the build is still failing

I noticed, working on it...
Oops, sorry, I misread how recent this was.

Thanks for your PR!
There are five places where I'd like a second pair of eyes: the remaining changes look good to me.
maintainer merge?

Thanks!

bors d+

Thanks for your PR!
There are five places where I'd like a second pair of eyes: the remaining changes look good to me.
maintainer merge?

Thanks!

bors d+
Can another reviewer double-check this is fine?

This is not my expertise but I'm indeed a bit suspicious about the fact that `add_comp` can't be `rfl` but `comp_add` can.

If `rfl` is okay, then we don't need the `by`:
```suggestion
  comp_add _ _ _ _ _ _ := rfl
```
I guess this is fine, but please double-check.

I suppose this works because `n.succ = 0` gets reduced away?

An alternate proof for the whole theorem: `by cases k <;> simp [pow]`.
I guess this is fine, but please double-check.
Yeah, the two `rfl`s in this file seem ok. They could be turned into new `@[simp]` lemmas too, but I don't know if that's worth the effort.
I guess this is fine, but please double-check.
I guess this is fine, but please double-check.

Either `rfl` or keep `ext` and delete the porting note entirely: looks like it only used to work because the goal looked something like `(fun i ‚Ü¶ g (x.coeff i)) = (fun i ‚Ü¶ ((WittVector.map g) x).coeff i)`, and now the RHS gets eta-reduced into `((WittVector.map g) x).coeff` at some point.
`rfl` then

```suggestion
protected theorem coe_toBasis (b : OrthonormalBasis Œπ ùïú E) : (‚áëb.toBasis : Œπ ‚Üí E) = ‚áëb := rfl
```

This could be a `simp only`, but on the other hand the current form is nice since it would warn us when we add a new `simp` lemma that allows us to remove the `rfl`.
```suggestion
  simp only [isometryOfOrthonormal, OrthonormalBasis.map, LinearIsometryEquiv.symm_trans,
```

pullRequest.title: chore: remove a few porting notes
